result.execSummary:
The defendant Rudy Godoy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: *Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

miscConds.notes: *Restitution is set at $1063.98 payable to Emilia L. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED to restitution as stipulated to be defendant.

*Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. .
*Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.

*NO contact with firearms.
*48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

*NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
*NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest for "domestic abuse or harassment".
*NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.

*Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
*Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
*Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
*AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

timeConds.notes: *Serve 25 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 2-12-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rudy Godoy

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rudy Godoy in court.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Rudy Godoy in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Rudy Godoy in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  AS to count 1:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Count 2 is ordered dismissed and read in.
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 months in the House of Correction, with credit for 0 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 14 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 25 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 2-12-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
-Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest for "domestic abuse or harassment".
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. .
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-Restitution is set at $1063.98 payable to Emilia L.  ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED to restitution as stipulated to be defendant.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Rudy Godoy in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for final pretrial on 10-21-2015 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 11-4-2015 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 9-25-2015.  ls  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 08:16 am.

Defendant Rudy Godoy in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case heard off the record. Due to court calendar, case adjourned for Status Conference in branch 38.  Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Rudy Godoy in court.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears Pro Se.  
Defendant ordered to the Public Defender's Office to determine eligibility.  Defendant returns from Public Defender's Office.  Defendant does qualify for representation.  Case adjourned for Status of Counsel in Branch 4 on 8-13-2015 at 1:30 pm.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Emilio L., and Dewayne B., no guns in possession and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.. mld

15RM031079  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06-25-2015
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Emilio L. and Dewayne B.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Rudy Godoy in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 04.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
